alert.note: Alert for Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 22 at 5:03PM CST until February 23 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL RANKIN...NORTHWESTERN SMITH AND SOUTHERN SCOTT COUNTIES... At 503 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Pelahatchie, or 10 miles southwest of Morton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Morton and Pulaski around 520 PM CST. Homewood around 530 PM CST. Forest and Hillsboro around 540 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Polkville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
